title: Top 20 wild beaches in Britain
text:
Published 1 minute ago Each day this week we reveal the greatest British spots off the beaten track. Today: secluded beaches 
South West 
Speke’s Mill Mouth Hartland Quay, Devon The north Devon Hartland coast is one of England’s wildest and this large rocky beach is its most beautiful. A streamside walk through meadows leads to a 60ft waterfall plunging into a deep canyon. Dramatic folded cliffs tower and fingers of rock and sand reach to the sea. At low tide the long, sandy pools warm up in the sun; perfect for paddling and rockpooling. Location 50.9848 - 4.5297, EX39 6EA Eat Docton Mill Gardens and Tea Rooms, where you’ll find a delightful water garden just a 20-minute walk from the beach (01237 Subscribe now
